meanings.definition: The quality or state of being without historical authenticity or relevance.
meanings.sent1: The ahistoricity of the story made it difficult to believe.
meanings.sent2: The ahistoricity of the painting raised doubts about its origin.
meanings.sent3: The ahistoricity of the play led to some hilarious anachronisms.
meanings.sent4: Her ahistoricity in understanding ancient customs was like a fish out of water.
meanings.sent5: The ahistoricity of the legend made it seem like a fairy tale.

meanings.definition: The lack of historical perspective or context.
meanings.sent1: Without understanding the ahistoricity of the event, it was hard to grasp its significance.
meanings.sent2: The ahistoricity of the document made it challenging to interpret accurately.
meanings.sent3: His ahistoricity in conversations about the past often led to confusion.
meanings.sent4: The ahistoricity of her views on history was like looking through a foggy lens.
meanings.sent5: The ahistoricity of the map caused travelers to get lost easily.
